results:
Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about the Polish youth TikTok literature scene, adventure books, pirate themes, and BookTok trends.

## Polish BookTok and Youth Literature Trends

BookTok is a trendsetter in the world of literature, but also promotes reading, often among teenagers or young people, who very eagerly reach for Young Adult literature.(no content)The most popular genres are of course Young Adult and New Adult – these are what hot discussions in the comments revolve around.

### Key Polish BookTok Creators

The Polish BookTok scene features several prominent creators:

- The most active booktoker on Polish TikTok is Karolina. You can find new content on her profile all the time. These are both popular trends using books, as well as novel recommendations – there are plenty of the latter at @come.book.

- In Poland, literature-related content on TikTok is also created by, among others: Magdalena Adamus (known on TikTok as @catusgeekus), who reviews bestsellers and novels, Nela (@culturomaniaczka), who on TikTok focuses mainly on young adult titles, Łukasz (@okonwsieci), who devotes most time to crime novels, or Rafał (@wpadloczytadlo) where we can find mainly reviews of Polish and world literature.

### Popular BookTok Content and Trends

BookTok users mainly present reading lifestyle – book hauls consisting of showing purchased books, behaviors from the life of a typical reader, often referring to trending content on the platform, rankings, joint book arrangement on shelves or "crushing" on characters from favorite series.(no content)Among readers, popular trends include matching music playlists to books, showing interesting covers, and even presenting systems for arranging books on shelves. Among frequent motifs on BookTok, one can distinguish showing the most interesting fragments or illustrations, and for those eager for novel adaptations – matching potential actors to characters!

### Impact on Reading Habits

Every second person using TikTok in Poland admits that they bought a book they learned about thanks to the app.(no content)The NPD Group analytics company indicates that thanks to it, the young adult literature segment grew by 68% at the beginning of 2021 compared to the previous year.

### Popular BookTok Books and Genres

Titles that celebrated their triumphs on BookTok also include the "Courts" series by Sarah J. Maas, "The Song of Achilles" by Madeline Miller, "Malibu Rising" by Taylor Jenkins Reid (but also the well-received "The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo"), "The Cruel Prince" by Holly Black, or the "Six of Crows" series by Leigh Bardugo.(no content)Literature enthusiasts who share their recommendations on TikTok have repeatedly expressed appreciation for fantasy series such as The Folk of the Air and A Court of Thorns and Roses.

### BookTok's Influence on Literature Market

The hashtag #BookTok has already reached over 5.8 billion views, and some authors have recorded up to a tenfold increase in sales of their books thanks to it.(no content)In recent years, BookTok has grown into the most dynamic and opinion-forming book community online, whose influences have dominated bestseller lists also in Poland.

While the search didn't return specific information about pirate-themed adventure literature trends on Polish BookTok, the results show that fantasy and adventure genres are very popular, with series like "Six of Crows" (which features pirates and adventure themes) being frequently mentioned among BookTok favorites.
